titleStmt.title: The mask'd devil, or Quaker, neither fearing God nor reverencing man in an excellent and true description of these monsters (not men), made up of meer incongruities, as plainly appears by the late perfidious practice (of the seven Quakers which were lately convicted and to be transported) impartially represented in this ensuing narrative.
titleStmt.author: Manning, Edward.

titleStmt.title: The mask'd devil, or Quaker, neither fearing God nor reverencing man in an excellent and true description of these monsters (not men), made up of meer incongruities, as plainly appears by the late perfidious practice (of the seven Quakers which were lately convicted and to be transported) impartially represented in this ensuing narrative.
titleStmt.author: Manning, Edward.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained, and with print show-through.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
